newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Three policemen die in blast in south Russia.
newsitem.headline: Three policemen die in blast in south Russia.

text.p: Three policemen were killed and two others were seriously injured when their armoured personnel carrier was hit by an explosion in the southern Russian republic of North Ossetia, a local Interior Ministry spokesman said on Saturday.
"According to preliminary information, the blast appears to have been caused by an anti-tank mine," the spokesman told Reuters by telephone.

The explosion occurred on Friday afternoon near the border with another Russian republic, Ingushetia. Both republics are located next to breakaway Chechnya, where rebel guerrillas successfully waged a 21-month war against Russian troops.
The spokesman said the policemen had been on their way to help another police vehicle which had hit a mine in the area. There were no casualties in the earlier incident.
"As spring comes and the snow melts we fear there may be more accidents like this," the spokesman added.
The North Ossetian Interior Ministry wants Russian troops to help clear mines in the area, he said.
Peace has returned to Chechnya following an accord signed between the rebels and Moscow last summer but the region remains awash with weapons, ammunition and mines.
